page.title: 02USE OF NATURAL FEATURES
page.content: The River Ouse runs between huge flood-banks;the level of water in the banks is above the fields in many places.When the peat is drained it shrinks and so the fields are below the river level.To prevent flooding the river is embanked.The Ouse is canalised here having been straightened to make it easier to navigate. The main embankment,Middle Fen Bank, is a special feature,a roddon.Thousands of years ago,when streams and rivers ran through the fens,silt carried in the streams was deposited as the current slackened.This silt gradually built up to form a core in the peat.When the peat was drained these silt deposits became small ridges called roddons.The main road from Ely to Prickwillow follows another roddon.
